page.title: 04Housing (continued)
page.content: In recent times old people's homes and sheltered accommodation have been built near Hall-ith-Wood and at Eagley Court on Darwen Road.The latter has 37 residents,average age 80-90,living in flats.There are more women than men. Affetside is a small isolated village.It has cottages that are 150-200 years old and that were built for coal miners or as shops and public houses.Most of the homes had outside toilets and no water so they had to collect it from a well.Some however, had underground water-pumps.
